activationCode.description: The code the system generates when it processes the activation.

description.description: The description of the resource that you want to register.

expirationDate.description: UTC timestamp in [RFC3339 format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.8) by which this activation request should expire. The default value is 24 hours from resource creation time. This provider will only perform drift detection of its value when present in a configuration.

expired.description: If the current activation has expired.

iamRole.description: The IAM Role to attach to the managed instance.

name.description: The default name of the registered managed instance.

registrationCount.description: The number of managed instances that are currently registered using this activation.

registrationLimit.description: The maximum number of managed instances you want to register. The default value is 1 instance.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the object. .If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

tagsAll.description: A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider `default_tags` configuration block.
